metadata.title: RA Family: The IRQ number is set by the FSP configurator, is there a way to change it?

sections.content:
Question:
In the FSP Configurator, when I set the interrupt used by the driver, an IRQ number is automatically assigned, is there a way to change this?
Answer:
Not within the configurator. To change the IRQ number manually, edit the ra_gen/vector_data.c and ra_gen/vector_data.h generated by the configurator. Please note that these files may be overwritten or written back by the configurator. Note that depending on the MCU, there may be restrictions on the interrupt event number that can be assigned to each IRQ number. Check the Interrupt Controller Unit (ICU) chapter of the user's manual of the MCU device to see if it can be assigned.
